subject: Breaking Records
event: HBO's GAME OF THRONES continues to build. Sunday's episode recorded our strongest ratings to date, breaking the record set the previous week, which broke the record set the week before that, which... http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/tv-ratings-game-thrones-momentum-516711 Let us hope the trend continues this Sunday with my own episode, AUTUMN STORMS... er, CHAINS... no, THE BEAR AND THE MAIDEN FAIR. Yeah, that's the ticket!

comments.article:
I am extremely pleased every week! This show absolutely deserves it. I never saw a show that made me feel so much anger, happiness (not so much of that though, heh), sadness and fear. I can not wait to see what is in store for us, and I already ordered the books too!

You made a truly epic story Mr. Martin, I am honored to experience it in my life!
comments.subject: A Song of Ice and Fire

comments.article: Can't wait for next sunday :)

May the dumptrucks full of money continue to run express to Santa Fe! I am curious as to the the reason behind name change from the original of "Autumn Storms," however. It seemed like the perfect title for that dark and stormy night we're all looking forward to. I do understand why the new title would make sense, though.

Looking forward to saying hello at Worldcon and perhaps discussing plots and schemes for defeating Evil Little Bill in the coming months :)
comments.subject: Well deserved congrats.

comments.article:
I haven't always understood the changes that have been made from the books, but I trust that you guys are only changing what has to be changed. I absolutely love the show (almost as much as the books, but not quite). I can't wait to see how you are going to handle book four as a series, and I'm in a permanent state of anxiety/euphoria thinking about the release of book six. Keep up the outstanding work, Ser.

A grateful fan :)
comments.subject: Kudos

comments.article: Super excited about your episode!  I doubt it will top 'Blackwater', but I know it will be great!
comments.subject: YEAH!

comments.article: "Autumn Storms" was an awesome name, but if a certain scene I've glimpsed in a couple of trailers is in your episode, well, you can't really do much better than "The Bear and the Maiden Fair."

Great news...yet not surprising!

George, do you have that hideout picked out yet for after Episode 9 airs??
Looking forward for next sunday´s episode, hope The Bear and The Maiden Fair breaks another record. Keep up the good work!
Do you know which episode you'll be in charge of in the 4th season?
comments.subject: Season 4 GRRM episode

comments.article: I do.  I've already written it.
comments.subject: Re: Season 4 GRRM episode

comments.article: This is great news for you and us all!  it's all very exciting!
comments.subject: Huzah!!!

comments.article:
My favorite character in the series. I love how the show has handled that storyline and I want Nikolaj Coster-Waldau to atleast be nominated for an Emmy or GG.

I've read and watched several of your interviews and know of your love of wriiting Tyrion and Arya. And your difficulty of getting into Bran's skin. But is Jaime a character that for the most part you're able to write with ease? His character arc is strong and flows so well, and I'm always left remembering his quotes at the end of his chapters.
comments.subject: Jaime Lannister is...

comments.article: I've loved the last two episodes in particular, and now trust that where the series diverges from the books, if it is of consequence it will be resolved later. Poor Ros!
The show is the best I have watched and the series is the best I have ever read and we all thank you! I have to ask where did you get the inspiration for the R'hllor faith?
comments.subject: Thank you!

comments.article: Don't worry, the combination of your imagination and the books is definitely not second best.
The title scene was moved from another episode.  Likely one or more of my scenes may have been moved out to make room for it, but I won't know until I actually see the finished show.
Awesome! I cannot wait. :)

Excellent, I always look forward to your episodes. It can't get any better than when it comes directly from the source. Bryan Cogman's episodes are turning out to be well worth the wait, as well. I also enjoy Michelle MacLaren's work so this coming Sunday should be a real treat indeed!
Knowing what's going to happen, probably, I think "The Bear and the Maiden Fair" is the perfect title.
I only hope you kept Jaime's detailed dream in this episode, it is much fun and it seems fundamental to the story...

I love when u write an episode just to have a week of peace on the message boards instead of brutal arguing between book "purists" and everyone else. And the two you've done so far have been great, especially The Pointy End.

I don't mind literary arguments, so long as they remain polite.

In fact, I rather enjoy them.

My sweet congrats to HBO, and for everyone who work on the show. This episode, for me, was the best till now! Each episode is better than the next. If this one, and the "Now His Watch is ended" had a huge impact on me, I imagine Rains of Castamere. Once again: Congratulations to everyone on the show.
comments.subject: Congrats!

comments.article: give us one more episode with R ;(
comments.subject: please, don't kill them all

comments.article: Quiet, you; I enjoy blood in the gutters. An episode without at least five deaths is a dull affair.
comments.subject: Re: please, don't kill them all

comments.article: The episodes this season have been the strongest yet. Exceptionally crafted. You have a lot to live up to. Looking forward to it.
Are there any real life individuals which inspired the character of Petyr Baelish? And of actual historical people, would Lord Baelish have found any personally meaningful or "heroic"?
comments.subject: Littlefinger's inspiration

comments.article:
You were complaining last month about record levels of piracy. How exactly do you think these records are being set? It's not like someone's going to walk into GoT cold halfway through the third season - all those people watching it on HBO are people who've already seen the previous episodes. If more people watch this episode than the last one on HBO, it's because people have watched the last episode off HBO(i.e., via piracy) and are now watching it live.

Personally, I own all the books, both seasons on Blu-Ray, and have an HBO subscription...but I still pirate it when I miss an episode, because I don't have a PVR and it's just easier than waiting for the rerun. Saw last week live, so I contributed to that record, but I missed the week before. I suspect most of the increased viewership did the same.
